citations.narrative:
The current records of animals on hand do not accurately reflect the animals at the facility. None of the birds at the facility
were listed, the number of rabbits and opossums was inaccurate, and the goat was not listed. The record did not indicate
when a kangaroo and wallaby left the facility or where they went. There is no record for the date that many of the rabbits
were born at the facility.
Acquisition and disposition records, including offspring born at the facility, are necessary to accurately track and identify
animals being used in regulated activities.
A current inventory with all required information must be maintained for animals on hand, any offspring born on premises,
and animals sold, transferred, or that have died.
Correct by: July 20, 2024.

No contingency plan was available for review at time of inspection. Planning for an emergency in advance will help
provide for appropriate handling, treatment, transportation, housing and care of the animals in the event of an emergency
or disaster. The facility shall develop and document an appropriate contingency plan for its regulated animals in the event
of an emergency or disaster, review it annually and train all employees on the plan.
Correct by: July 20, 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a written program for environment enhancement for their birds. Facility representatives have
been providing the birds with some enrichment opportunities; however, a documented program has not been developed.
A written plan for environment enrichment is necessary to ensure the psychological well-being and overall health of the
birds.
Exhibitors must develop, document, and follow a species- appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to
promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must address
social grouping, environmental enrichment, special considerations, and exemptions.
Correct by: July 20, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The current records of animals on hand do not accurately reflect the animals at the facility. None of the birds at the facility 
were listed, the number of rabbits and opossums was inaccurate, and the goat was not listed. The record did not indicate 
when a kangaroo and wallaby left the facility or where they went. There is no record for the date that many of the rabbits 
were born at the facility.  
Acquisition and disposition records, including offspring born at the facility, are necessary to accurately track and identify 
animals being used in regulated activities.  
A current inventory with all required information must be maintained for animals on hand, any offspring born on premises, 
and animals sold, transferred, or that have died. 
Correct by: July 20, 2024. 
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
No contingency plan was available for review at time of inspection. Planning for an emergency in advance will help 
provide for appropriate handling, treatment, transportation, housing and care of the animals in the event of an emergency 
or disaster. The facility shall develop and document an appropriate contingency plan for its regulated animals in the event 
of an emergency or disaster, review it annually and train all employees on the plan. 
Correct by: July 20, 2024. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility does not have a written program for environment enhancement for their birds. Facility representatives have 
been providing the birds with some enrichment opportunities; however, a documented program has not been developed. 
A written plan for environment enrichment is necessary to ensure the psychological well-being and overall health of the 
birds. 
Exhibitors must develop, document, and follow a species- appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to 
promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must address

social grouping, environmental enrichment, special considerations, and exemptions. 
Correct by: July 20, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
